title: Claudio Ranieri to 'appear on Sky Sports' Monday Night Football' and break silence on Leicester sacking
text:
Sport Claudio Ranieri to 'appear on Sky Sports' Monday Night Football' and break silence on Leicester sacking Ranieri has stayed out of the public eye since his sacking last month but he is now prepared to tell all on national TV Share Ranieri was presented with a Golden Bench award earlier this week (Photo: Getty) Share Get football   
Claudio Ranieri is set to speak out about his sacking from Leicester City in an appearance on Sky Sports' Monday Night Football. 
Ranieri will reportedly appear as a studio guest on the April 10 edition of the show ahead of the Crystal Palace vs Arsenal fixture, which is being shown live. 
The Italian is expected to give a frank and honest assessment of his time at the King Power Stadium and the events that led to his sacking. 
Regular Monday Night Football pundit Jamie Carragher was a continual backer of the 65-year-old during the period when he was removed from his post. Monday Night Football has had a host of special studio guests in the past (Photo: Sky Sports) Ranieri was sacked as Leicester manager earlier this year (Photo: Clive Rose) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Kasper Schmeichel denies players spoke to Leicester owners Share this video Watch Next 
Since his sacking, Ranieri has remained out of the public limelight as Leicester have gone on to secure four wins out of four under Craig Shakespeare. 
Ranieri received a special prize at the Italian coach of the year awards earlier this week and reportedly told the Daily Mail that he was returning to speak. 
"I will come back for Crystal Palace versus Arsenal," Ranieri allegedly said. Ranieri lifted the Premier League title with Leicester just last year (Photo: Getty) He was removed from his role following a poor run of form (Photo: REUTERS) 
The La Panchina D'oro (Golden Bench) recognises the top managerial achievements in the top three tiers of Italian football but Ranieri was honoured for his title-winning exploits in the Premier League. 
Since leaving Leicester, Ranieri is believed to have rejected job opportunities in Germany, Turkey and China. 
He has used the last month to spend time with his family and friends in London, Rome and Monte Carlo. poll loading Was it the right decision to sack Claudio Ranieri? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
